sent: GNU Emacs was created by GNU Project founder Richard Stallman.
The Hypertext Editing System, or HES, was an early hypertext research project conducted at Brown University in 1967 by Andries van Dam, Ted Nelson, and several Brown students.
Far Manager was created by Eugene Roshal, and has been under development by the Far Group since 2000.
ikiwiki is a free and open-source wiki application, designed by Joey Hess.
Under Carmony's direction, Linspire started and sponsored Nvu, hiring Daniel Glazman, former Netscape Communications Corporation employee, to be the lead developer.
Meduza is a Riga-based online newspaper and news aggregator in the Russian language, headed by Galina Timchenko, the former editor-in-chief of Russian news website Lenta.ru.
VDR was originally written by Klaus-Peter Schmidinger, one of the founders of CadSoft Computer GmbH and original developer of the EAGLE electronic design application.
Maps.me was founded by Yury Melnichek, Alexander Borsuk, Viktor Govako and Siarhei Rachytski.
QDOS is the multitasking operating system found on the Sinclair QL personal computer and Sinclair QDOS's clones.
The Messages app received support for MMS, while the Camera app received support for video recording on the iPhone 3GS, and a new "Voice Memos" app let users record IPhone OS 3's voice.
Virtua Racing was initially a proof-of-concept application for exercising a new 3D-graphics platform under development, the "Model 1".

Though Robinson 's Requiem was initially released for the Atari ST, Atari Falcon and Amiga microcomputer platforms, the game was later ported to other home computers and consoles including the PC, Macintosh, 3DO Interactive Multiplayer and Atari Jaguar CD, some of which were released by several publishers across multiple regions and with each one featuring several changes and additions compared to the original versions.
The collection was released on ZX Spectrum, Amstrad CPC, PC, Nintendo Entertainment System and Commodore 64.
The Commodore 64 version was considerably different in gameplay to the ZX Spectrum and Amstrad CPC versions.
Magicland Dizzy is a platform adventure game published in Europe in 1990 by Codemasters for the ZX Spectrum, Commodore 64 and Amiga platforms.
ACS was originally published by Electronic Arts (EA) in 1984 on the Commodore 64, and was later ported to the Apple II, Amiga, and MS-DOS.
Archon was originally written for the Atari 8-bit family and then ported to the Apple II, Commodore 64, Amstrad CPC, ZX Spectrum, Amiga, IBM PC, Macintosh, PC-88, and NES.
Home computer ports of Blasteroids were released by Image Works for the Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, MSX, MS-DOS, and ZX Spectrum.

The game was ported to many home computers by Ocean Software in 1989, including versions for the ZX Spectrum, Amstrad CPC, Commodore 64, MSX, Amiga and Atari ST. Taito produced versions for the Family Computer (1989), Game Boy (1990), Master System (1990), TurboGrafx-16 (1990), Game Gear (1991) and Saturn (1996).

Saboteur II: Avenging Angel, also known as just Saboteur 2, is an action-adventure game created by Clive Townsend and released by Durell Software in 1987 for the ZX Spectrum, Amstrad CPC, Commodore 64 and MS-DOS Compatible platforms.
19 Part One: Boot Camp is a multi-part action video game released by Cascade Games in 1988 for the Commodore 64 and ZX Spectrum.
007 : Licence to Kill was released for Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, BBC Micro, Commodore 64, DOS, MSX and ZX Spectrum.
NOS / VE is a virtual memory operating system, employing the 64-bit virtual mode of the CDC Cyber 180 series computers.
The A-0 system (Arithmetic Language version 0), written by Grace Murray Hopper  in 1951 and 1952 for the UNIVAC I, was an early compiler related tool developed for electronic computers.

Sherlock Holmes : Consulting Detective was originally developed by ICOM Simulations for the FM Towns computer and later ported to DOS, Apple Macintosh, Commodore CDTV, TurboGrafx-CD, Sega CD and Tandy Video Information System with all versions being distributed on CD-ROM.
Army Moves is a scrolling shooter game developed by Dinamic Software for the Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, MSX and ZX Spectrum.
VU-3D is a 3D modelling software for the ZX Spectrum home computer.
Halls of the Things was ported to the Amstrad CPC amd Commodore 64.
Home computer ports of Blasteroids were released by Image Works for the Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, MSX, MS-DOS, and ZX Spectrum.
Jim Power in Mutant Planet is a platform video game developed by Digital Concept and published by Loriciel for the Amiga, Atari ST and Amstrad CPC in 1992.
Zybex is a 1988 horizontally-scrolling shooter for the Commodore 64, Atari 8-bit family, and ZX Spectrum.
Andromeda Conquest is a 1982 strategy video game released for the Apple II, Atari 8-bit family, Commodore PET, MS-DOS, and TRS-80.
Audiogenic published versions of the original game for the Acorn Electron, BBC Micro, ZX Spectrum, Amstrad CPC, Commodore 64, Atari ST, Amiga, and IBM PC in 1990 and 1991.
GS/OS was included as a component of Apple IIGS System Software versions 4.0 through 6.0.1.
OCP Art Studio or Art Studio was a popular bitmap graphics editor released in 1985, created by Oxford Computer Publishing and written by James Hutchby (original ZX Spectrum version).

Sherlock Holmes : Consulting Detective was originally developed by ICOM Simulations for the FM Towns computer and later ported to DOS, Apple Macintosh, Commodore CDTV, TurboGrafx-CD, Sega CD and Tandy Video Information System with all versions being distributed on CD-ROM.
Delta 16 was originally released for the Commodore 16 home computer, then ported to Commodore 64 for which it was released free of charge.
Castle of Riddles is a text adventure released by Acornsoft for the BBC Micro (in 1982) and Acorn Electron (1984) home computers.
Zork III was released for the Amstrad CPC, Apple II, Atari 8-bit family, Commodore 64, CP/M, IBM PC (as a self-booting disk), MSX, TRS-80, then later for Macintosh, Atari ST, and Amiga.
Around the same time, the release of iPhone 4 and IOS 4's subsequent antenna problems made Apple focus on unsuccessfully attempting to patch the issues with software updates.
Yie Ar Kung-Fu II was released for the Commodore 64, MSX, Amstrad CPC, ZX Spectrum, BBC Micro and Acorn Electron home computer systems and featured a different approach to the game.

Laser Squad is a turn-based tactics video game, originally released for the ZX Spectrum and later for the Commodore 64, Amstrad CPC, MSX, Amiga, Sharp MZ-800 and Atari ST and PC computers between 1988 and 1992.
The Commodore 64 version was considerably different in gameplay to the ZX Spectrum and Amstrad CPC versions.
A version for the Commodore 16 and Commodore Plus/4 was also released in 1984.
The game was originally written in BASIC for the Commodore PET, but later ported to other early home computer platforms including the TRS-80 and Apple II.

The first version was released in 1982 and spawned two major revisions in addition to several add-ons and, later, tailored versions for the +2 and +3 Spectrum models, the SAM Coupé, the MSX, the Timex TS2068 and the Amstrad CPC range.

Arkanoid was ported to many home video game platforms, including the Commodore 64, Nintendo Entertainment System, ZX Spectrum  and mobile phones, and it spawned a long series of sequels and updates over the course of two decades.
Hellfire Warrior is a dungeon crawl video game for the Apple II, Commodore PET, and TRS-80 published by Automated Simulations in 1980.

Barbarian: The Ultimate Warrior is a video game first released for Commodore 64 personal computers in 1987; the title was developed and published by Palace Software, and ported to other computers in the following months.
SOS initially ran on the IBM 709 computer and was then ported to SHARE Operating System's transistorized successor, the IBM 7090.
Cauldron II was first released on the Commodore 64.
3-D Monster Chase is a first-person maze game written by Dave Noonan and released by Romik in 1984 for both the Amstrad CPC and the ZX Spectrum.
Applesoft BASIC is a dialect of Microsoft BASIC, developed by Marc McDonald and Ric Weiland,  supplied with the Apple II series of computers.

Arkanoid was ported to many home video game platforms, including the Commodore 64, Nintendo Entertainment System, ZX Spectrum  and mobile phones, and it spawned a long series of sequels and updates over the course of two decades.

WAITS was a heavily modified variant of Digital Equipment Corporation's Monitor operating system (later renamed to, and better known as, "TOPS-10") for the PDP-6 and PDP-10 mainframe computers, used at the Stanford Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (SAIL) from the mid-1960s up until 1991; the mainframe computer it ran on also went by the name of "SAIL".
The collection was released on ZX Spectrum, Amstrad CPC, PC, Nintendo Entertainment System and Commodore 64.
Initially released for the Commodore 64 in 1985, HardBall ! was ported to other computers over the next several years.
Tasword featured the ability to use a 64 characters per line font in the standard ZX Spectrum screen.
Red Hat Enterprise Linux is released in server versions for x86-64, Power ISA, ARM64, and IBM Z and a desktop version for x86-64.
The game was ported to the Atari 8-bit family, Commodore 64, Atari 2600, and Atari 5200 and renamed to The Incredible Wizard for the Bally Astrocade.

Leisure Suit Larry in the Land of the Lounge Lizards is a graphic adventure game originally released in 1987 originally developed for the PC DOS and the Apple II, it was later ported to other platforms such as the Amiga, Atari ST, Apple IIGS, Apple Macintosh, and the Tandy Color Computer 3.
3D Tunnel is a ZX Spectrum video game developed by New Generation Software and published in 1983.
Colossal Cave Adventure (also known as ADVENT, Colossal Cave, or Adventure) is a text adventure game, developed between 1975 and 1977 by Will Crowther for the PDP-10 mainframe.
Archon was originally written for the Atari 8-bit family and then ported to the Apple II, Commodore 64, Amstrad CPC, ZX Spectrum, Amiga, IBM PC, Macintosh, PC-88, and NES.
BESYS (Bell Operating System) was an early computing environment originally implemented as a batch processing operating system in 1957 at Bell Labs for the IBM 704 computer.
From 1985 to 1988, the game was released for the Apple II, Atari 7800, ZX Spectrum, Acorn Electron, BBC Micro, Amstrad CPC, and Master System.
TSX-Plus is a multi-user operating system for the PDP-11/LSI-11 series of computers.
007 : Licence to Kill was released for Amiga, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, BBC Micro, Commodore 64, DOS, MSX and ZX Spectrum.
The Nokia Lumia 1320 smartphone is a phablet smartphone in the Lumia series developed by Nokia that runs the Windows Phone 8 operating system.
Unveiled on SeptemberÂ 6, 2016, and LG V20 marks the first phone to feature the Android Nougat operating system, it is a successor to the LG V10 released in 2015.

The HTC Touch Pro (also known as the HTC Raphael, AT&T Fuze, XDA Serra, or MDA Vario IV)  is a smart phone from the Touch series of Internet-enabled  Windows Mobile Pocket PC smartphones designed and marketed by HTC Corporation of Taiwan.
The HTC HD Mini is a smartphone running the Windows Mobile operating system with HTC Sense.
HP Elite x3 is a premium Windows 10 Mobile smartphone produced by Hewlett-Packard.
NEC PC-100's OS was MS-DOS and was also equipped with a spreadsheet program Maruchipuran (Multiplan) and a text editor JS-WORD as well as the game Lode Runner.
Acer beTouch E200 runs Windows Mobile 6.5 operating system and it was released in October 2009.
The HTC TyTN II (also known as the HTC Kaiser, the HTC P4550, and the HTC 8925) is an Internet-enabled Windows Mobile Pocket PC smartphone designed and marketed by HTC Corporation of Taiwan.
Nike), is a Windows Mobile-powered Smartphone in the HTC Touch family.
The Nokia Lumia 520 is an entry-level Windows Phone 8 smartphone announced by Nokia at the 2013 Mobile World Congress.
The Nokia Lumia 735  is a Windows Phone 8.1  smartphone developed by Nokia.
The Alcatel One Touch Fire is one of the first generation of smartphones preinstalled with Firefox OS, an open-source mobile operating system developed by Mozilla.
The Xiaomi Mi A2 (also known as Xiaomi Mi 6X) is a mid-range smartphone co-developed by Xiaomi and Google as part of Android One program.
A Chromebook is a laptop or tablet running the Linux-based Chrome OS as its operating system.

Code-named "Tube", Nokia 5800 XpressMusic was the first touchscreen-equipped S60 device by Nokia - essentially it was the first device to run Symbian^1, also known as S60 5th Edition, the touch-specific S60-based platform created by the Symbian Foundation.
Notably, this is only the third phone to be sold with the Ubuntu Touch mobile operating system, after the BQ Aquaris E4.5 and the Meizu MX4.
The HTC Touch Viva is a windows mobile smartphone developed by the High Tech Computer Corporation of Taiwan.
